text: Earl Frederick "Spider" Balfour (January 4, 1933 – April 27 2018) was a Canadian NHL hockey player. He was born in Toronto, Ontario. Balfour served as a forward from 1952 to 1961. He was a defensive forward and penalty-killing expert. Balfour won the Stanley Cup with the 1960–61 Chicago Black Hawks. He also played for the Toronto Maple Leafs. He retired after 288 games, posting 30 goals, 22 assists, 52 points and just 78 penalty minutes. Balfour died on April 27, 2018 of prostate cancer in Guelph, Ontario, aged 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1933 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey forwards Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Pittsburgh Hornets players Category:Rochester Americans players Category:Ice hockey people from Toronto Category:Toronto Maple Leafs players Category:Ontario Hockey League players
